Legal_Issue: Credible implausibility findings by Refugee Protection Division
Evidence_Assessment: RPD's implausibility findings lacked verifiable evidence; speculation used regarding blood feud re-emergence and neighbor spying
Decision_Outcome: Rejection of refugee claim based on credibility
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to establish credible basis for fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: Applicants' explanation deemed implausible without cultural context or reliable evidence
Legal_Rule: Implausibility findings must be based on clear evidence and consider cultural context; unsupported speculation is insufficient
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide adequate reasoning for credibility assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution due to re-emergence of blood feud
Outcome_on_Merits: Not determined – original decision set aside
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Decision found to be in reviewable error
Review_Standard: Standard of reasonableness applied by Federal Court
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: RPD failed to meet procedural fairness by relying on speculation
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicants' testimony regarding blood feud and surveillance by neighbors
Legal_Framework: Refugee protection under IRPA and jurisprudence on credibility and plausibility
Applicant_Challenge: RPD’s adverse credibility determination based on implausibility
Court_Result: Decision overturned, case referred back for re-determination by a new panel
Legal_Rule_Source: Federal Court jurisprudence on credibility and implausibility in refugee claims
Defendant_Response: RPD rejected claim based on implausibility of narrative
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, narrative account of blood feud
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of RPD decision and referral for re-determination
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review followed by re-hearing before RPD
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: None – claim based on well-founded fear of persecution
Applicable_Process: Refugee protection division hearing and federal court judicial review
Governing_Rule: Rules of natural justice, statutory framework of IRPA, and Federal Courts Act
